values:
A sound like a ghost howling inside a reverb-tank breaks free, and today it is still real.  My heart races in spite of the cup of coffee which sits undrunken and the drugs that sit undone.  The physical waves of emotion are stunning, stupefying, free entirely from the mark of nostalgia.  This record is now, this connection euphoric, this moment I'm lost in something more than a memory.

And to someone else, it's already the long sad shadow of another time.  And to someone else, it's nothing at all.  Ethereal, free-roaming messages.  The world at that window looks bluer than white. The air coming in is cold (and now so is my coffee) but it smells of waxing life. And I can feel myself returning with the winds as they settle down to breezes.

I listened to Crimpshrine this morning.  The last time I'd really heard those songs was on a Measure tour, and long enough ago that I don't remember which one.  I greeted songs that once were the world to me and I felt the distance in time.  The morning was almost ruined with the stink of nostalgia when "Living in the Past" came on, and while the faces the lyrics called to mind were, for the most part, not the same one's conjured when I was 19, the feeling was exactly the same.  I seem to get used to changes, but never to change.

So last month I went on Bad Hug Radio on RLC (90.3 Piscataway) and played a few acoustic versions of Asteroid Blues tunes - a few of which I've put MP3's of up at: http://www.myspace.com/asteroidbluesnj

And check out Bad Hug Radio at: http://www.myspace.com/badhugradio
My InGenre column for this month is up at: http://ingenre.com/2009/09/v/#more-524

Hey Everyone,
      I'm writing a new monthly column for the website "InGenre".  My first column is up now at http://ingenre.com/2009/08/cowboy-bebop/ so come check it out.  Thanks!

Mike
We shape the universe; always towards the ends of story.

$2 in person, $3 with shipping. All proceeds will go to fundraising efforts for the American Foundation for Suicide Prevention's Out of the Darkness Overnight Walk. Please help out. E-mail: quit.talkin.claude@gmail.com to order.

I've nearly posted passages from this book almost every day this week, this one was too good to resist:

     "They did not awaken quickly, nor fling about nor shock their systems with any sudden movement.  No, thay arose from their slumber as gently as a soap bubble floats out from its pipe.  Down into the gulch they trudge, still only half awake.  Gradually their wills coagulated.  They built a fire and boiled some tea and drank it from the fruit jars, and at last they settled in the sun on the front porch.  The flamin flies made haloes about their heads.  Life took shape about them, the shape of yesterday and of tomorrow."
     - John Steinbeck

Mediocre worker seeks par time oppurtunity:

Minimal responcibilities wanted.  Job must be "Dog Friendly" and preferibly in New Brunswick.  Being able to come to work high a must, being able to get drunk on company stock while at work a plus.  A cable package including the history channel, discovery, and at least two related channels an absolute must.  Expected salary of $5-10, but $15-25 if I have to do actual work.  The ability to play pool for free all day a plus; a lax attitude towards punctuality and attendance a definite plus.

Dear friends,

G4 is running a contest to send an American to compete on Ninja Warrior... this is, in fact, the single moment I've been looking towards, unknowingly, for my entire life.  

In order to enter the contest I must submit a video demonstrating to the judges why I am qualified to compete. 

I need from you, my friends, suggestions of deeds to do and treacherous places in which to do them; preferably unmolested by officers of the law.

Also, I video camera.

Please help me fulfill my dream!

I'm very serious!

even with the sress and uncertainty of tour looming on the very immediate horizon, being finished with school and work for two whole weeks i feel an immense releif.  i challenge anyone to listen to "california stars", in the car with the windows rolled down and on a day like today, and not feel that you're moving uncontrolled and inevitably west.  we're all ultimately moving toward some kind of paradise; today i'm driven, mostly, by the sound of eighth notes being clattered out on a piano and the smell of fresh cut grass.

i feel like i owe myself words... not words composed to tell a story, to batter my head against the gates to a dream i'm losing sight of as i begin to size up the opposition... but words inward, to reflect on the past year... and the time before that... i don't come to grips with my missing of things past, of people gone... i ignore and bury till the first warm breezes come with the marking of another year and blow my cover... exposing what i try to hide, thrusting it into my drunken face like, "happy birthday, asshole"

what?

"and how good it felt to kill the memory of nights spent holding your shirt for the smell" and jay smalls leans into me, sums up everything i'm feeling saying, "i can still remember what this song used to mean to me, i'm going to get another drink."

through the rain through the afternoon, to liquor stores that don't carry 40's and greasy spoons with "coffee milk"...

ratty carpets, grey walls, the double hits of tuning guitars (they never quite make it)...

there's a sudden excitement of basements or living rooms filled with strangers...

strangers with comic book backpatches, and pretty strangers, and strangers who know about tomatoes and blueberries. strangers who paid attention and strangers who moved.

breakfast, repeatedly, throughout the weekend and constantly improving.

new records, old comics, polaroid pictures.

100,000 miles...

if someone ever compiled a book of my life and there were quotes at the openings of all the sections (and of course there would be), i think i'd like one of them to be:

"mr. narrator, this is bob dylan to me, my story could be his songs, i'm his soldier child" - d.boon

check one more dream off the list and head up route 18 with the windows rolled down.  double nickles on the dime plays low and the conversation rolls freely, from social schisms to tour plans and onward to 6am.  tales of jackassery and unlikely dialogs chew away at the night.  why does anyone bother to sleep through nights like these?

but then again, i've never done anything in my life i've been as proud of as the recordings i've just finished with "the measure"

www.myspace.com/themeasuresa

my fingers are passed sore and into numb... the nerve endings have shut down from 9 hours of steady abuse... i have a new used leather jacket that somehow became mine in a bartering to finance this recording... i have hours of overdubs and desperate attempts to sing to a reel of magnetic tape ahead of me... i still have half a bottle of jameson's left, and monday morning i will have me a sammich should hell itself try and stand in my way...

winter exits lamb-like stage left, we are done with you motherfucker!

from circular discussion in smoke and dinge trying to define "primitive" as it applies to music to maelstroms of sweat and feedback finding that definition for ourselves, our lives are lead in poorly lit bars and basements... aluminum cans, unfiltered cigarettes... the imagery is redundant, the buzz and racket constant...

maybe it's just the winter finally ending but the energy grows every night like a storm...

to my friends: i love you and thank you and kindly request that you continue to buy me whiskey at every opportunity!

warms hours on the porch, chilly walks through cemeteries talking about life and futility... out of context and strangely perfect in it's own right... crowded sweaty basements and steamy storefronts... quiet bars behind locked doors till 4am... it's been a good couple of days... a really good couple of days... still, as the wind down i feel trapped, beaten, and so fucked up i'm going to explode... i can almost do it... i can almost move...

"i miss the thunder, i miss the rain"

sometimes i sit at work under the harsh fluorescent lights waiting for it to be time to leave, and i can almost smell dinner being lovingly cooked in a kitchen i've never seen but somehow seems more familiar then any i've ever known... but then sometimes i look at my arms, my veins vivid green under those same fluorescent lights and i fantasize about hypodermic needles, methamphetamine, and one great cliff dive off on an unimpeded path of self destruction...

sitting on my back porch and i'm smoking my last lucky strike, eric says something like "we're friends with the ghosts of our friends"... it strikes me as acutely true... i flick the cigarette into a lingering snowbank and wrap my hands around cold pvc pipe... it occurs to me that even this, exhilarating and life affirming though it may innately be, is really just an attempt to revive well loved memories...

my house, particularly the lab, appears to be overpowerd by entropy... i've broken three different strings in three different guitars in the course of one afternoon... i'm somewhat convinced if i leave my house i will be struck by lightning... here goes nothing...
post a comment telling me about the first time we met. then put this in your livejournal

i've got this problem, where i beleive too much in longshots...

sometimes, i'll be playing hold 'em and i'll have an ok pocket, but the flop and turn wont bring me much... but i'll keep betting just to see the river, then the river comes, and i've still got next to nothing, suddenly theres a dillema... there's no point to keep betting because i've got nothing, but it seems silly to fold because i've got so much money on the table, so much staked on such a slim chance, and whatever decision i make, i've already blown it...

this is what life feels like right now...

everyone else is posting at the close of thanksgiving... i missed this, i missed these people, even the ones i see every night, who live a block away, or a flight of stairs... i miss chainsmoking american spirits, drinking coffee till one am, driving the waitress crazy, random encounters... i miss trading comic books at the end of the night, synopses, the way this bead feels like a cacoon...

i spent the first snow of the year in sussex county, driving the curves and hills, the warble of cassette tapes...

it should problably have snowed this weekend too, it would have been more cinematic...

sweaty and delirious, a long weekend of passions... some that wont be felt, or at least felt live and raw and pure as fuck, ever again... sweaty clothes piled on the floor, i spend the day sleeping off the last two, delirium finding it's way even into my dreams... the imminent and recent endings seeming to outweigh in their intensity even the new beginnings i've been looking forward too, it's going to be a long month, i think i've almost paid my dues to this town, if only i could figure out a way out... johnny x sings another hero's words, "down here it's just winners and losers, don't get caught on the wrong side of that line" and i wonder if theres any chances left here...

tell me a secret. anonymously.

(ip logging is off)

i hadn't really thought about her in any way that resembled missing until i found out how far away she really was... maybe it's just jealousy because i'm starting to feel like i'll be the last one to leave... i look through pictures as a silent "how are you" and everything looks good; and suddenly i realise that every muse i've ever had is miles and miles away... out beyond state lines... and i still can't play the old songs right... every significant event that happens, in my life or around it, it seems to be exactly the right event... like some big picture is being drawn, some next phase... life in new brunswick goes well, the fall is coming along nicely... i'm content, as i usually am around this time of year, at the prospect of shows, parties, costumes, and coats... at the prospect of huddling in warm bars on cold nights... but still, i lacerate myself daily about the fact that i'm still here... i'm burning another hole in my belly...

i can remember skating down the road to "hey, daddy!" bagels where my friend ethan worked, jittery, awake for 30 hours or so... caroline left sleeping drunkenly on scott's fold out couch... i remember sitting down as he took his break, free bagels in a brown paper bag, smoking cigarettes and talking about books... he was starting to read more and more about buddhism, i was criss-crossing genre's and mediums with abandon... whatever looked good to steal, or somebody thrust into my hands, i'd read it... i joked that together we'd add up to one whole dharma bum, it was a pretty bad joke... we wound the conversation off talking about thompson...

this kinda thing happened maybe 3 or 4 times tops, but it seems in retrospect, to have been an integral routine of that summer... it's what i was thinking as i drove from my old home roads back up to new brunswick after saying good-bye and wishing him well on a rather impromptu move on his part, three thousand miles away to portland with people he barely knows... 

it got me started thinking about those fringe friendships and those little routines, and about how that's always been the hardest thing for me to let go... it got me thinking about the past and about leaving new jersey for good... it got me thinking about how i keep getting older, and everyday i'm making leaving that much harder to do... that everyday i'm making a lot of things harder on myself, because all i ever seem to do is wait... and wait... and wait...

all the goodbyes had been said, the departures made... whoever was still here was here for another eternity... we all got together and shaved each others heads, mohican, a display of solidarity... it'd become hard to tell what was an act of satire and what was an act of faith, we'd become so far gone that everything we did was equally motivated by hope and disillusionment... jay and grundle dubbed it the summer of destroy everything... i had a feeling we wouldn't be too far off

encapsulate all that we got
within our doubts and fears
you wash it down with p.b.r.
and i'll smoke away the years
the jukebox here, it's pleadinging
ask me, ask me, ask me
but the only question that comes to mind is
what the fuck are we doing here, girl
what the fuck are we doing here

and our faith was always lacking
in ourselves most of all
if i hadn't been so quiet
hadn't been so withdrawn
if we hadn't been so stubborn
so resolute in our ways
maybe we coulda compromised
coulda found a better way

but i couldn't stop you from drinking
and you couldn't stop me from overthinking everything
and you could't help to soothe the anger
that burned inside my belly 
as it threatened to consume me
to take me out from the inside

and our faith was always lacking
in ourselves most of all
if i hadn't been so quiet
hadn't been so withdrawn
if we hadn't been so goddamn stubborn
so resolute in our ways
maybe we coulda compromised
coulda found a better way

encapsulate all that we got
within our doubts and fears
we'll cut it off
pack it up
end the story of our year

my lip is sore... chewing on it clenching my teeth for three days sore, i always favor the left side and i blame david...the screen flickers from exhaustion... third weekend in a row like this (fourth?)

two sunrises and little bit of protein
spent the mornings laughing out smoke

it was blue velvet... the couch, not the movie
it was louis the 14th syle and upholsered in blue velvet
it was the most god awful uncomfortable thing i'd ever planted my ass on, and pj used to sleep on it, even after we moved it to the kitchen... of course, pj's also been know to frequently fall asleep on kitchen floors waiting for coffee to brew, addiction may be a disease, but, atleast in this case it's a funny one... like scurvy, or the clap

the junkies who slept on the floor wheren't as funny, but i don't think this stories about them... there was a girl upstairs, who was addicted to a boy, who was addicted to hard liquor by the liter, and i was addicted to her... but i don't think this stories about any of that either... i think i meant to talk about the house itself... like most houses in new brunsick it had been broken up into little apartments, and ours, atleast on the surface, was exactly what you'd expect... we had an ashtray and a radio in every room, we had three t.v.'s in the living room and not a single one of them had cable, whe had a pair of rabbit ears on one of them, but the only time we ever used it was to try and whatch the ball drop through all the static a week after we moved in... we sang old lang sai or however it's spelled, though nobody knew the words, and most of us where fudging the melody... come to think of it, we went upstairs to do that, all our tv's ever got was snow...

i'd like to think despite the short time we spent there (the six months encomassing a grueling winter and unredeeming spring) we made up for it in pure volume of drugs and alcohol consumed, minors corrupted, neigbors disturbed, guns pulled on our guests by afformentioned disturbed neighbors, parties thrown, video games conquered, and bad movies watched...

the backyard was this junkpile, just shit cluttered everywhere, car parts, hunks of concrete, a steel drum (of the hobo peruasion as opposed to the rasta kind)... at our first or second party j puked from too much mad dog and it covered the whole step in purple ice, 18% by volume... as the months went on it got more cluttered with trash and shit, because we never figured out the garbage schedule, we'd just throw it in the back yard and once in a while the cokehead who lived upstars would tell us when to put it out...

the inside wasn't much better, we we're supposed to have a dishwasher but it never worked so we would just let the dishes pile up and when we ran out just kep washing and reusing the ones on the top... all we needed was one pot, and one frying pan, we lived of of perogies, saffron rice, powdered ice tea, coffee, and peanut butter... sometimes pj'd bring leftovers from his uncle resturant, sometimes i'd loot my parent's house for cheese... bagel bites were our caviar, mountain dew was my dom periogn, spelling has never been my strong point...

i was drunk for a week strait... which is a pretty pittiful binge all things considered, but i gave it the old college try...

ever seen the star wars holiday special? worst thing i've ever lost sleep for, and i mean that... well, maybe the original x-men pilot with the australian wolverine

watching edge of quarrel and drinking 151, connor and j spooning later that night, the first time i did adderol, the scar on my nose because you shouldn't play with swords while drinking, the fact that i was the second person to make that mistake within a month, the fact that it took an hour for the blood to clot and once it did i was drunk after one drink... i suppose i could sum the whole thing, the good parts anyway, into three images: having almost a dozen people over watching the batman&superman animated movie while passing around a bottle of soco; a handful of us after the first match and moth show, already good and drunk in the junkpile backyard passing around a bottle of malibou since we'd drank every last drop of anything else in the house; and of course, pj passed out on the kitchen floor waiting for that god damn coffee machine

should i ever succesfully dupe enough people into the delusion that i'm a competent writer, that some poor asshole publishes me; and should i further dupe enough poor fools to have a film made of some work of fiction my cranial bowls have shit out, please, remind me to take a page from allan moore and not bother to watch it, i'm sure it's a policy that's served him well

the place was a shit-pit, that new brunswick basement stink of stale beer, sweat, and mildew, you can almost taste the dirt in the air... i love  these places.
i was drunk, drinking pabst, the descendents where on the stereo, and somehow there was a beautiful girl here, with me, also getting drunk... the odds of my not sleeping alone that night were the best they'd been in months, everyone in the basement was shouting

it'd been a good night, and it was steadily improving... her scarf was real long and it kept draggin on the floor, the keg was tapped and we sat in the corner, inching closer and closer as we (i) drunkenly slid down the wall, heels digging in the dirt floor propping myself up, and she leaned in and i leaned in, and she pulled back...

"i wouldn't want you to do something just cause you're drunk"

i looked at her, i looked at my beer cup, i looked back at her and grinned

"i got this drunk just to get the nerve to do this at all"

we kissed, we ate fallafel, we passed out awkwardly on a small couch, it was a good night, 'cause nothing says romantic like adolescent hardcore and cheap beer
slept right on through the first snow...

top 10 reasons to get a full time job 

roy orbison records 
food 
shonen knife records 
comics 
a vintarge marshall half stack with a tube head 
ikeaville (and the prospect of not living here forever) 
my girlfriend (and the prospect of soon living together) 
the bisexual nun 
xbox live and true fantasy online 
poker night 

10 good reasons to run off to california and live as a bum till the end of my days 

my health 
my sanity 
my continued independent education 
really great rock and roll 
it's the otlaw thing to do 
crystal methamphetamine 
ikeaville (and the prospect of being as far away from here as humanly possible)
donuts 
warm weather 
sleep

From: "Mike Regrets" <brokenheros@hotmail.com>  
To: kharolyne@aol.com  
Subject: and this is all we know  
Date: Wed, 12 Feb 2003 03:51:22 -0500  
   
from those first nights really talking in that spring two years ago, i've loved you, i've felt some connection with you that i could hardly compare to anything else, and comparisons don't do any feelings justice... it's 3:25 in the morning, i can't sleep, after too many cigarettes, noise, crowded basements, i still end up in the quiet, and i can't do anything but think about you... i do miss you, i miss lying next to you, not even touching, just knowing you were there... i miss the hope i had, the idea that two people could eventually connect, feel everything for one another, be everything to one another, the idea that love was something as simple as two people finding happiness in being together, i lost all that on you... the idea that love can be so skewed and one sided, it was to much for my fragile hope to bear 

i trail off, i don't even know why i'm writing this, i'm a stubborn man, and an angry one... i don't think this can be salvaged, even if it can, i wouldn't know where to start, how to begin... it's to big to think about, to intimidating to even try... failure marks my life only because i don't know how to face anything at all, or never bother to attempt simply out of fear of failure... it doesn't matter, call it a flaw, call it what little defense i have, i was ready to lay down all my walls, i was willing to give everything i am and everything i have, to share my life with you, if you're wanting now for something we had, it's unfortunate, because you threw the idea of us away, i'm just closing the door on something that was already lost and left unfinished... 

because i learned early on that hope was a lie, it just took me until now to beleive it 

love 
mike 

"and this is all we know so this is how it's going to stay i think i would rather remember how it was and go our seperate ways i don't feel anything unless we're living and dying for each other every second of our lives" -against me!

sure, i'll say i'm wiping the slate clean, i've got goals, i've got hopes, moments of clarity are easy when you decide not to drop to the bottom of a bottle, clenching my teeth looking for a little peace, the night crashing over me like waves, and i should hate the sea by now, and i'm so fucking selfish, and when i stop complaining sometimes i see how fucking lucky i am, throwing fortune into the fire for the sake of having a song to sing

no more wishing, copper is copper, stars are fires too far off to keep us warm, walking aways was always the easiest choice to make, tonight though, i think it's the right one too, the path of most resistance doesn't always bring us anywhere better, and how many hard road stories can i fit into 45 second bursts?

in this clearing, on the cusp of everything, where is this taking me, where am i taking myself, words wont hold an edge, it's to thin, the angles poorly judge, i'm wasting time between anger and sleep, a fury in my belly, how much time can i waste? clenching my teeth looking for peace, how much time can i waste?

so maybe when the cd changed and the first few notes of the magnificent seven came through i stopped and thought about you

so maybe for just a second the resentment fell aside and i just wondered how you were, what you were doing

so what the fuck do i do now?

in the movies it's a sudden switch, a kiss, a cry, the heartbroken hero's fumbling speach, all at once everything we understand thus far changes, lies i've fed myself since childhood... doubly cursed with an inability to find the right words and to know when to shut the fuck up, i'm ramble across the diner table like a fool, did it seem like laying guilt? the words came out in the wrong shape again, i don't blame anyone except myself, and maybe fate just a little bit, i wrote this a dozen times over in the car ride home, speeding, shaky hands...

in the movies it's a bottle that takes this away, but there's nothing but a bad migraine in the bottle, and the little white pills have the last of been vanished, to numbing and trying to reason, and tonights sleep gets cast aside to green eyes and wishes, comic book 5am, more childhood lies, lies about heroes, lies about fate.....

lies i can't help but lose myslef in...

i'm sorry
we cut our hands of the ties that bound us boxcars looming over the road at night longing for the comfort of a bed that i'd grown to hate

letting myself fall again
covered 45 miles in 30 minutes
just hoping to say goodnight

i can feel the alcohol in my blood but not the escape it promises, and tomorrow i'll start again, the release of tension has grown stale but i can't bring myself to get moving again, theres no more catharsis in walking the streets in the heat

theres no more in anything i do, 
ritual... no, habit

7 hours and i don't feel rested at all chemical sleep grabbing hold before i even got a chance to think about dreams and dharma about miles or anything else

dirty hair and dirty clothes and nobody i know is quite right anymore, he's muttering drunk on the side, i'm smoking too much, trying to make the most of this little morning peace...
